content.description: Start as low as possible with your right hand in a crack and use a sloper for your left. Make your way up the left side of of the boulder to the top point. Crux is first couple moves, feet are a little goofy. An easier variation starts matched in the crack higher up and goes to to the same finish
content.protection: A briefcase pad ought to be all you need
content.location: Back side of the little pentagon boulder, left side.

content.description: Start matched on a decent rail on the center/right of the back face, use some crimps to gain the lip and topout up at the point. If you are tall its pretty easy to slap up to the lip.
content.location: Right side of the little pentagon boulder

content.description: A short 8-10ft goofy little boulder is the first block you come to off the Mattatuck trail from the Carter Road trailhead, from the right angle it has a pentagonal shape to it. Though this block is short, it is worth a slap if you are in the area since it is such a close approach. Not really sure what rock type it is (conglomerate? gneiss?) but it white with black and gray streaks/waves and climbs different than other rock in the area. There are a couple lines on the face pointing away from the road and some various other traverses. The back face gets afternoon sun.Be mindful of neighbors in the area! This boulder is close to the road and within earshot of a couple houses, please keep your volume down if you go here.
